intro: Lecardia, commonly known as the golden bellflower, is a flowering plant belonging to the Campanulaceae family. It is characterized by its bell-shaped, yellow-orange flowers that bloom in late summer. The plant typically grows in moist, well-drained soils and prefers partial to full sun. Lecardia has lance-shaped leaves that are often hairy, and it is native to regions in the Americas. It is often cultivated for its ornamental value in gardens and landscapes.
